GNServer

Class DataBaseController

  • java.lang.Object
    • GNServer.DataBaseController

  • public class DataBaseController
extends java.lang.Object
    The class manages all incoming and outgoing information from the database, including executing SQL queries while maintaining the integrity of the constructed database.
    Version:
    March 2024
    Author:
    Shoval Ben-Shushan, Gad Azriel, Adar Budomski, Yotam Gilad, Tomer Ben-Lulu

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataBaseController

        public DataBaseController()
        Establishes a connection to the database.
        Parameters:
        empty. -

      • DataBaseController

        public DataBaseController(java.lang.String host,
                          java.lang.String sechma,
                          java.lang.String userName,
                          java.lang.String password)
        Constructs a DataBaseController to manage database connections and initial data loading. It initializes the connection, fetches starting data for parks (Disneyland, Universal, Afek), and cleans outdated records. Errors during any step are logged to the console.
        Parameters:
        host - - Database server host.
        sechma - - Database schema name.
        userName - - Database access username.
        password - - Database access password.

      • InsertNewReservation

        Inserts a new reservation into the database based on the provided Reservation object and updates the reservation ID..
        Parameters:
        order - - The reservation details to insert into the database.

      • checkReservationID

        public java.lang.String checkReservationID(Reservation order)
        Checks if a reservation ID exists within the specified park's database.
        Parameters:
        order - - The Reservation object containing the ID and park name to check.
        Returns:
        "yes" if the reservation ID exists, "no" otherwise.

      • checkIfUserExsit

        public boolean checkIfUserExsit(java.lang.String userName)
        Checks if a user exists in the database.
        Parameters:
        userName - - The username(String) to check.
        Returns:
        true if the user exists, false otherwise.

        Inserts a new single visitor's details into the database.
        Parameters:
        order - The Reservation object containing the visitor's details.

      • CheckFreeSlots

        public boolean CheckFreeSlots(Reservation order)
        Checks for availability of slots for a given reservation.
        Parameters:
        order - The Reservation object containing the reservation details.
        Returns:
        true if there are enough slots available, false otherwise.

        Retrieves available visiting hours for a given day based on the reservation details.
        Parameters:
        order - - The Reservation object with the specified date.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of available hours as strings.

      • DMparks

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> DMparks(User user)
        Retrieves a list of park names managed by a specific department manager. This method queries the 'parks_details' table to find parks where the 'ParkDepartmentManager' column matches the provided user's username. It compiles a list of these park names and returns them.
        Parameters:
        user - - The user object whose username is used to identify the parks they manage as a department manager.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of strings containing the names of the parks managed by the specified user.

      • TotalVisitorsNumReport

        public java.lang.String TotalVisitorsNumReport(Report report)
        Generates a total visitor number report for a specific park and time period. This method calculates the total number of single and group visitors to a park within a specified date range, based on the 'report' parameter details. It then inserts these totals into the 'visitors_report' table in the database.
        Parameters:
        report - - The report (object) details including park name, start date, and end date for the visitor count.
        Returns:
        A string "yes" indicating the operation completed successfully. Errors during execution are logged via e.printStackTrace().

      • GetTotalVisitorsNumReport

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> GetTotalVisitorsNumReport(Report report)
        Retrieves the total number of single and group visitors from a previously generated report. This method selects the number of single and group visitors from the 'visitors_report' table for a specific park and date range, as specified in the 'report' parameter. The numbers are added to an ArrayList, with the first element representing single visitors and the second element representing group visitors.
        Parameters:
        report - - The report (object) details, including the park name, and the start and end dates of the report period.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing two integers: the number of single visitors and the number of group visitors, respectively.

      • CreateUseReport

        public java.lang.String CreateUseReport(Report report)
        Creates a usage report for a specific park and time period. This method inserts a new entry into the 'use_report' table with the park name, start date, and end date specified in the 'report' parameter.
        Parameters:
        report - - The details of the report (object), including the park name and the date range for the report.
        Returns:
        A string "yes" indicating that the operation was completed successfully. SQL exceptions are logged.

      • DisplayUseReport

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> DisplayUseReport(Report report)
        Generates a list of dates and times when the park was not at full capacity within a given date range. This method iterates over each day in the specified date range, checking for free slots (times when the park was not at full capacity) on each day.
        Parameters:
        report - - The report (object) containing the park name and the date range (from and to) for which to generate the usage data.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of strings, each entry corresponding to a date and time when the park was not fully booked.

      • IsUseReportExist

        public boolean IsUseReportExist(Report report)
        Checks if a use report already exists for a specified date range and park.
        Parameters:
        report - The Report object specifying the park name, start date, and end date for checking.
        Returns:
        true if the report already exists, false otherwise.

      • CheckFreeSlotsByHourForReport

        public boolean CheckFreeSlotsByHourForReport(Reservation order)
        Checks if there are free slots available at a specific hour for a given reservation, considering the park's maximum visitors and stay duration.
        Parameters:
        order - The Reservation object containing details such as park name, visit date, and visit time.
        Returns:
        true if there are free slots available at the specified hour, false otherwise.

      • CheckFreeSlotsByDateForReport

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> CheckFreeSlotsByDateForReport(Reservation order)
        Checks for available visiting hours for a given day tailored for reporting purposes, considering the park's capacity and stay duration.
        Parameters:
        order - The Reservation object with the specified date and park name for the report.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of strings representing available hours for visitation.

      • EntranceToThePark

        public Reservation EntranceToThePark(SetTime entranceTime)
        Processes entrance to the park, updating the reservation status to "Active" and setting the entry time.
        Parameters:
        entranceTime - A SetTime object containing the reservation ID, park name, and entry time.
        Returns:
        A Reservation object updated with entry time and status.

      • ExitFromThePark

        public boolean ExitFromThePark(SetTime exitTime)
        Marks a reservation as "Inactive" upon exiting the park and records the exit time.
        Parameters:
        exitTime - A SetTime object containing the reservation ID, park name, and exit time.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful.

      • checkReservationIDWhenEntranceToThePark

        public java.lang.String checkReservationIDWhenEntranceToThePark(SetTime entranceTime)
        Checks if the reservation ID provided exists in the park's database when attempting to enter the park.
        Parameters:
        entranceTime - A SetTime object containing the reservation ID and park name.
        Returns:
        "yes" if the reservation ID exists in the database, "no" otherwise.

      • VisitReport

        public java.util.ArrayList<Visit> VisitReport(Report report)
        Generates a report of visits for a specific park within a given date range where the reservation status was 'Inactive'. This method queries the database for visits based on the 'report' parameters, selecting the visit time, entry time, exit time, and type of visitors for each inactive reservation within the specified date range. It calculates the duration of each visit and stores the information in a list of Visit objects.
        Parameters:
        report - The Report object containing details such as the park name and the date range for the report.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Visit objects, each representing a specific visit that occurred under the conditions specified.

      • CalcDuration

        public java.lang.Float CalcDuration(java.lang.String entryTime,
                                    java.lang.String exitTime)
        Calculates the duration between two times in hours.
        Parameters:
        entryTime - The entry time in the format "HH:MM".
        exitTime - The exit time in the format "HH:MM".
        Returns:
        The duration between entry and exit times in hours as a Float.

      • RegisterGroupGuide

        public java.lang.String RegisterGroupGuide(java.lang.String id)
        Registers a user as a group guide based on their ID, if they have the potential and are not already a group guide. This method checks if the user with the specified ID has marked themselves as 'wanna be' a group guide and is not already registered as a 'Group' type user. If the conditions are met, it updates the user's type to 'Group' in the database. If the user does not exist, is not marked as 'wanna be', or is already a group guide, the method returns "no".
        Parameters:
        id - The user ID to check and potentially update.
        Returns:
        A string "yes" if the user was successfully registered as a group guide, "no" otherwise.

      • CreateCanceledReport

        public CanceledReport CreateCanceledReport(Report report)
        Generates a report detailing the number of unresolved and canceled reservations for a park over a given period. This function counts unresolved (either approved or awaiting payment) and canceled reservations per day within the specified range. It stores these counts in two HashMaps keyed by date, then compiles these into a CanceledReport object that summarizes the data.
        Parameters:
        report - The criteria for the report, including park name and date range.
        Returns:
        A CanceledReport object with daily counts of unresolved and canceled reservations.

      • CreateCanceledReportForAllParks

        public CanceledReport CreateCanceledReportForAllParks(Report report)
        Creates a consolidated report of canceled visits and unresolved orders for all parks. This method takes a report object, splits the park names, and generates individual canceled reports for each park. It then aggregates the data for all parks into a single report, summing up the amounts of canceled visits and unresolved orders across all parks.
        Parameters:
        report - The initial report object containing the park names and the relevant dates. The park names should be in a comma-separated string format within the report object.
        Returns:
        A CanceledReport object that contains the total amounts of unresolved orders and canceled visits across all parks specified in the input report. The 'parkName' of the returned report will be set to "all" to indicate that it represents aggregated data for all parks.

      • RequestUpdateParameters

        public boolean RequestUpdateParameters(Parameters parameters)
        Requests an update to park parameters, inserting or updating a request as needed. If no existing request matches the given parameters, a new one is added. Otherwise, the existing request is updated. Both operations set the request status to 'Waiting'. Consistency in park name casing is maintained.
        Parameters:
        parameters - Details of the parameter update request.
        Returns:
        true, indicating the request submission was successful.

      • CheckIfParametersExist

        public boolean CheckIfParametersExist(Parameters parameters)
        Determines if an update request for a specific parameter in a park already exists. Searches the database for a matching parameter type within the specified park.
        Parameters:
        parameters - The park and parameter type to check for existing requests.
        Returns:
        true if an existing request is found, false otherwise.

      • GetDMOfPark

        public java.lang.String GetDMOfPark(java.lang.String parkName)
        Fetches the Department Manager's ID for a given park. Performs a database search using the park name to find the associated Department Manager's ID. Returns the ID if found, or an empty string if not found or an error occurs.
        Parameters:
        parkName - The park's name.
        Returns:
        Department Manager's ID or empty string.

      • DisplayParametersForDM

        public java.util.ArrayList<Parameters> DisplayParametersForDM(java.lang.String id)
        Fetches pending parameter update requests for a specific Department Manager. Looks up requests with 'Waiting' status assigned to the given Department Manager's ID, compiling them into a list.
        Parameters:
        id - Department Manager's ID.
        Returns:
        List of pending Parameters.

      • AprrovedDeclinedParameters

        public boolean AprrovedDeclinedParameters(Parameters parameters)
        Updates the status of parameter requests and applies changes if approved. For a given parameter request, this function sets its status to either approved or declined. If approved, it also updates the park's details with the new parameter value.
        Parameters:
        parameters - Details of the parameter update, including status and new value.
        Returns:
        Always returns true, indicating the operation was attempted.

      • CheckGroupGuide

        public boolean CheckGroupGuide(java.lang.String id)
        Verifies the existence of a user by their ID. Searches the database for a user with the given ID. Returns true if the user is found, otherwise false.
        Parameters:
        id - User's ID to check.
        Returns:
        true if user exists, false if not.

      • fetchOrders

        public java.util.ArrayList<Reservation> fetchOrders(java.lang.String parkName)
        Retrieves all reservations for a specified park. This method fetches reservation details from the database for the given park name. It constructs a list of Reservation objects from the database records, including reservation ID, user ID, number of visitors, visit day, visit time, phone number, email, reservation status, visitors type, and prepayment status.
        Parameters:
        parkName - The name of the park for which to fetch reservations.
        Returns:
        A list of Reservation objects containing details of each reservation.

      • CancelReservation

        public void CancelReservation(Reservation order)
        Cancels a specific reservation. Updates the reservation status to 'Canceled' in the database for the given reservation by setting the 'ReservationStatus' field of the specified park's table.
        Parameters:
        order - The reservation to cancel, identified by its reservation ID and park name.

      • DeleteFromWaitingList

        public void DeleteFromWaitingList(java.lang.String parkName,
                                  java.lang.String date,
                                  java.lang.String hour,
                                  java.lang.Integer queueID)
        Deletes a specific entry from a waiting list table in the database. This method constructs the table name is dynamically based on the provided park name and deletes the entry that matches the specified queue ID, visit day and visit time.
        Parameters:
        parkName - The name of the park, used to determine the specific waiting list table.
        date - The date of the visit in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD'.
        hour - The hour of the visit in 24-hour format 'HH:MM'.
        queueID - The unique identifier of the queue entry to be deleted.

      • SwitchingFromWaitingListToRegularReservation

        public void SwitchingFromWaitingListToRegularReservation(Reservation order)
        Moves a reservation from the waiting list to regular reservations if a slot becomes available. This method checks the waiting list for the specified park and date/time to find the next eligible reservation. If there's an available slot (checked via CheckFreeSlots), it deletes the reservation from the waiting list and adds it as a regular reservation. It then notifies the user about the update to their reservation status.
        Parameters:
        order - The base reservation details used to identify the waiting list entry.

      • GetAllReservationsFromAllParksById

        public java.util.ArrayList<Reservation> GetAllReservationsFromAllParksById(java.lang.String id)
        Retrieves all reservations for a specific ID from multiple theme parks. This method aggregates reservations from all the existing parks in the system. based on the provided unique identifier (id = username). It's designed to compile a comprehensive list of all reservations associated with the given ID across these parks.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique identifier for which reservations are to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Reservation objects containing all reservations found for the specified ID across the mentioned parks. If no reservations are found, returns an empty list.

      • GetAllReservationsById

        public java.util.ArrayList<Reservation> GetAllReservationsById(java.lang.String id,
                                                               java.lang.String parkName)
        Fetches all approved or prepaid reservations for a user in a specified park. Looks up reservations by user ID and park name, returning those that have been approved or have received payment. Each reservation's details, like visitor count and visit times, are included.
        Parameters:
        id - The user's ID.
        parkName - The park's name.
        Returns:
        A list of the user's reservations in that park.

      • DeletionOfOutdatedRecordsFromWaitingList

        public void DeletionOfOutdatedRecordsFromWaitingList(java.lang.String parkName)
        Removes outdated reservations from the waiting list of a specified park. This method deletes records from the park's waiting list that are dated before today, effectively cleaning up past reservation attempts that were never fulfilled. It iterates through the waiting list, identifying and removing such outdated entries.
        Parameters:
        parkName - - The name of the park whose waiting list is to be cleaned.

      • GetAllParkDetailsByDMId

        public java.util.ArrayList<ParkDetails> GetAllParkDetailsByDMId(java.lang.String id)
        Gets details for parks managed by a given Department Manager ID. Queries the database for parks managed by the specified ID, including park name, max visitors, stay duration, and manager details. It then converts manager IDs to names by looking up each manager in the workers table.
        Parameters:
        id - Department Manager's ID.
        Returns:
        List of parks' details managed by the Department Manager.

      • GetAllParkDetailsById

        public ParkDetails GetAllParkDetailsById(java.lang.String id)

      • ImportWorkersData

        public static void ImportWorkersData()
        Retrieves park details for a given park manager's ID. Queries the park's details managed by the specified manager, including name, visitor limits, and stay duration. Additionally, converts the manager's ID to their full name for easier identification.
        Parameters:
        id - ID of the park manager.

      • ImportUsersData

        public static void ImportUsersData()
        Imports user data from an external table to the main users table if it hasn't been done already. First, checks whether the import process has occurred. If not, it proceeds to import user data, updating their status to indicate completion. Users are informed through a message about the import status - whether it was successful or had already been completed previously.

      • ChangeStatusToPayment

        public void ChangeStatusToPayment(Reservation order)
        Marks a reservation as paid. Verifies if a specific reservation hasn't been paid yet. If that's the case, updates its status to indicate the payment has been made.
        Parameters:
        order - Details of the reservation to update.
